Horizon reports

Welcome to a Jekyll project built on Bootstrap 5.0.2 to generate horizon reports using PDF Reactor.

Step 1 - Clone the repo and setup

First of all you need to clone the repository:

git clone git@github.com:akolinski/horizon-reports.git

Step 2 - Setup Postman

Download Postman first: https://www.postman.com/downloads

Then open up Postman and click on new to create a new request.

Enter https://cloud.pdfreactor.com/service/rest/convert.pdf as the request URL and make sure you are sending a POST request.

Click on body > raw and paste this code:

{
  "document": "https://akolinski.github.io/horizon-reports/reports/example-coaching-report",
  "conformance": "PDFUA1",
  "addLinks": 1,
  "addBookmarks": 1,
  "javaScriptMode": "ENABLED_TIME_LAPSE",
  "viewercodeferences": [
    "FIT_WINDOW",
    "PAGE_MODE_USE_THUMBS"
  ]
}

* Note if you paste in Postman and get a error please validate the above here: https://jsonlint.com

Click on Send

Click on Save Response and then Save to a file

Wooohooo! Your PDF has been created. Open the PDF up on your computer and see what it looks like.

Step 3 - How to create a report

  1. Create a new file in the _posts folder
  2. You are done, give yourself a pat on the back

Step 4 - How to access a report

You can access your reports here:

DEV: http://127.0.0.1:4000/reports/example-coaching-report

PROD: https://akolinski.github.io/reports/example-coaching-report

Reports live in the _posts directory

To add new reports, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-report.html and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for one of the example reports to get an idea about how it works.
